column1: While I knew I could contribute my knowledge in the middle of the Great Recession about the drivers of unemployment and effec tive policies to creat e jobs, I had never spent time working in government .

Little did I know that the data on prices and employment produced  - 6 - by the Labor Department would be the same data that I analyze in my current role at the Fed, looking for  evidence -based insights to make policy that benefits all Americans .
